study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate predictors of biochemical tumor control and develop a prognostic nomogram for prostate cancer patients treated with brachytherapy, including Iodine-125.
results_summary: The study found that Iodine-125 monotherapy at a dose of 144Gy was associated with improved prostate-specific antigen relapse-free survival (PSA-RFS), particularly when D(90) exceeded 140Gy. Androgen deprivation therapy did not impact tumor control outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with clinically localized prostate cancer (n=1,466).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of 2% povidone-iodine (PVP-I) solution in treating epidemic keratoconjunctivitis (EKC).
results_summary: The study found that 77% of participants recovered within a week of treatment, with no severe adverse effects reported. PVP-I was well-tolerated, with 78.7% of participants completing the 7-day trial.
population_specificity: Participants diagnosed with epidemic keratoconjunctivitis (EKC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether povidone-iodine or normal saline was more effective in preventing exit-site infections (ESI) and peritonitis in children on chronic peritoneal dialysis (CPD).
results_summary: The study found that normal saline was more effective than povidone-iodine in reducing ESI rates (1 episode/144 patient-months vs. 1 episode/60.8 patient-months), while peritonitis rates were similar between groups.
population_specificity: Children undergoing chronic peritoneal dialysis (CPD).
effective_dosage: Povidone-iodine or normal saline (0.9% NaCl) applied 2-3 times per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the incidence of hyperthyroidism, particularly Graves' disease and toxic nodular goiter, in an iodine-sufficient population (Sweden).
results_summary: The study found an annual incidence of hyperthyroidism at 27.6/100,000 inhabitants, with Graves' disease accounting for 75% of cases. Geographical differences in incidence were observed, but the overall rate was lower than international reports.
population_specificity: ~40% of the Swedish population (9 million inhabitants), including children, diagnosed with overt hyperthyroidism between 2003-2005.
study_duration: Not specified (diagnosis-based study, not an intervention)

study_goal: The study aimed to determine antibiotic susceptibility patterns of conjunctival flora in patients undergoing intraocular injection for choroidal neovascularization after repeated exposure to ophthalmic antibiotics, including povidone-iodine.
results_summary: The study found that repeated exposure to ophthalmic antibiotics (not iodine) led to increased resistance in conjunctival flora, but iodine's role was limited to its use as a pre-injection antiseptic.
population_specificity: 24 patients (48 eyes) undergoing unilateral intraocular injection for choroidal neovascularization.
effective_dosage: Not specified for iodine (used as povidone-iodine before injections).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the role of iodine in congenital thyroid dysfunction, including its effects within the mother-placenta-fetal unit and its impact on hypo- and hyperthyroidism.
results_summary: The abstract discusses iodine's role in congenital thyroid dysfunction but does not provide specific efficacy or safety outcomes related to iodine supplementation. It references clinical aspects of congenital hypo- and hyperthyroidism but lacks detailed results.
population_specificity: Neonates and the mother-placenta-fetal unit.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of iodine in thyroid hormone production and the consequences of iodine deficiency, particularly its impact on mental health and brain development.
results_summary: The study found that iodine deficiency is a significant cause of thyroid abnormalities and mental disorders, including brain damage and mental retardation in fetuses and infants, and psychological disorders in adults. Timely iodine supplementation can prevent these adverse outcomes.
population_specificity: Fetuses, infants, children, and adults.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the potential role of dietary iodine excess in the generation of BRAF point mutations linked to thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The abstract suggests a proposed link between dietary iodine excess and BRAF point mutations in thyroid cancer, but does not provide conclusive evidence or specific results regarding iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of thyroid cancer mechanisms)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of BRAF(V600E) mutations in iodine-resistant thyroid cancers and explore potential therapeutic interventions targeting BRAF.
results_summary: The study found that BRAF(V600E) mutations are prevalent in papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) and anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC), correlating with aggressive, iodine-resistant phenotypes. Research into BRAF inhibitors like sorafenib showed efficacy in iodine-refractory metastatic PTC, though their exact mechanism remains unclear.
population_specificity: Patients with papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) and papillary-derived anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC), particularly those with BRAF(V600E) mutations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence, pattern, and predictors of surgical site infections (SSI), including the role of iodine alone in skin preparation as a predictor of SSI.
results_summary: The study found that using iodine alone in skin preparation significantly predicted surgical site infections (OR = 17.6), indicating it was less effective compared to other methods. Staphylococcus aureus was the predominant organism in SSI cases, with some MRSA strains detected.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent major surgery at Bugando Medical Centre in Tanzania between July 2009 and March 2010.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss the utility of thyroid surveillance in Peutz-Jeghers syndrome (PJS) patients, particularly in relation to the occurrence of papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC).
results_summary: The study reported a case of PTC in a PJS patient, detected via neck ultrasound, and highlighted the potential inclusion of thyroid ultrasound in PJS surveillance programs. No direct effects of iodine were studied.
population_specificity: A 22-year-old woman with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome (PJS) and subsequent papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the risks, epidemiology, pathophysiology, and preventive measures related to contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) caused by iodine-based contrast media.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-based contrast agents are the third most common cause of nephropathy among in-patients, accounting for 11-12% of cases, and are associated with increased morbidity, prolonged hospitalization, and higher mortality. Preventive measures and close monitoring of renal function are necessary to mitigate these risks.
population_specificity: In-patients undergoing radiological examinations or therapeutic procedures using iodine-based contrast media.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of kinase inhibitors (not iodine) in treating progressive thyroid cancer subtypes.
results_summary: The study found that kinase inhibitors like vandetanib, motesanib, and others showed modest antitumoral effects in progressive thyroid cancers, though dose-limiting toxicities and some treatment-related deaths were reported. Additional phase III trials are needed to confirm if benefits outweigh risks.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive thyroid cancer (medullary, papillary, and follicular subtypes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of stereotactic brachytherapy (SBT) using iodine-125 seeds on survival time and outcomes in patients with progressive or recurrent low-grade glioma (LGG) after resection.
results_summary: The study found that SBT with iodine-125 seeds achieved a 35.9% tumor response rate and 97.3% tumor control rate at 24 months, with a median progression-free survival of 52.7 months. Overall survival was 245 months, and the treatment showed low morbidity (3.3% permanent morbidity).
population_specificity: 95 patients with progressive (43) or recurrent (52) low-grade glioma (WHO grade II) after resection.
effective_dosage: Not specified (stereotactic implantation of iodine-125 seeds).
study_duration: Follow-up ranged up to 156.4 months post-implantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iodine as a second-choice drug in managing hyperthyroidism during pregnancy.
results_summary: The study identified iodine as a second-line treatment option for hyperthyroidism in pregnancy, alongside beta-blockers, while thioamides remain the primary therapy. No specific efficacy data for iodine were detailed, but its secondary role suggests modest effectiveness compared to first-line treatments.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with hyperthyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of two concentrations of aluminium chloride hexahydrate (12.5%, 30%) for treating plantar hyperhidrosis, using iodine-starch (Minor's test) as a diagnostic tool.
results_summary: Both concentrations of aluminium chloride significantly reduced hyperhidrosis levels, with no differences in tolerability. The iodine-starch test and sniff test showed improvement in hidrotic areas.
population_specificity: 20 volunteers with hyperhidrosis plantaris.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure the concentration and chemical nature of radioiodine exhaled by patients after radioiodine therapy for thyroid diseases.
results_summary: The study found that exhaled radioiodine levels varied by thyroid disease type, with higher levels in cancer patients post-thyroidectomy. Most exhaled radioiodine was organically bound (94-99.9%), and the amount was small but not negligible on the first day after administration.
population_specificity: 47 patients with thyroid diseases (toxic goitre, Graves' disease, thyroid cancer).
study_duration: Measurements taken up to 26 hours after administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of fortified toddler milk on iodine status in young children, alongside other nutrients like iron, zinc, and vitamin D.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects, focusing instead on vitamin D outcomes.
population_specificity: Healthy toddlers aged 12-20 months living in Dunedin, New Zealand (n = 181).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether sorafenib improves progression-free survival in patients with locally advanced or metastatic radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found that sorafenib yielded a median progression-free survival of 58 to 84 weeks and disease control rates of 59% to 100% in phase II studies, prompting the phase III DECISION trial to further evaluate its efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with locally advanced or metastatic radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.
study_duration: Expected trial duration was 30 months from first patient randomization until planned PFS events were attained.

study_goal: To explore regional differences in iodine status and prevalence of thyroid diseases in Belgium.
results_summary: Iodine status was slightly higher in Flanders than Wallonia, with higher seafood consumption in Flanders. Wallonia had more thyroidectomies and anti-thyroid medication use, correlating with lower iodine excretion.
population_specificity: Children and adults in Belgium (Flanders and Wallonia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the need for updated guidelines incorporating new treatment strategies for thyroid cancer, particularly in relapsed and refractory cases unsuitable for surgical or radio-iodine treatment.
results_summary: The abstract emphasizes the importance of updated guidelines for thyroid cancer treatment, especially for relapsed and refractory cases, but does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer, particularly those with relapsed or refractory tumors unsuitable for surgical or radio-iodine treatment.

study_goal: To compare the sterilization effectiveness of topical povidone-iodine against ciprofloxacin and ofloxacin on conjunctival bacterial flora in patients undergoing cataract surgery.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine showed bacterial eradication in 77.3% of cases, less effective than ciprofloxacin (92.5%) but more effective than ofloxacin (66.6%). The study concluded ciprofloxacin was most effective, though ofloxacin reduced bacterial flora more than povidone-iodine in pretreatment cultures.
population_specificity: 164 patients scheduled for cataract surgery.
effective_dosage: 5% topical povidone-iodine applied once on the day of surgery.
study_duration: Single application on the day of surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of systemic targeted radiotherapy using iodine-131 (131I) for differentiated thyroid cancers and neuroendocrine tumors, focusing on therapeutic approaches and critical organ considerations.
results_summary: The study found that systemic radiotherapy with 131I and MIBG has shown promise in extending disease survival but lacks clear safety limits, particularly for MIBG in adult neuroendocrine tumors. Most therapies involve multiple administrations of subtoxic radioactivity, with bone marrow as the primary critical organ and secondary organ involvement (renal or pulmonary) depending on the therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancers and neuroendocrine tumors, including pheochromocytoma and medullary thyroid cancer.
effective_dosage: Not specified (subtoxic amounts of radioactivity used in multiple administrations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and feasibility of Iodine-131-labeled meta-iodobenzylguanidine ((131)I-MIBG) therapy for treating refractory neuroblastoma in high-risk patients.
results_summary: The study found that (131)I-MIBG is an effective and relatively well-tolerated treatment for refractory neuroblastoma, though establishing a therapy program requires significant planning, resources, and multidisciplinary expertise. The abstract highlights the need for proper facilities, procedures, and education to ensure compliance with radiation exposure standards.
population_specificity: Patients with high-risk, recurrent, or relapsed neuroblastoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate treatment recommendations for pediatric differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including the use of radioactive iodine therapy.
results_summary: The study recommends radioactive iodine therapy for remnant ablation or residual disease in pediatric DTC, emphasizing its role in reducing recurrence and facilitating long-term follow-up. It highlights the need for expert management due to the complexity and potential complications of treatment.
population_specificity: Children with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the role of iodine-131-labeled lipiodol as a radiotherapy-based treatment in the management of unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: The study highlighted iodine-131-labeled lipiodol as one of the radiotherapy-based treatments for HCC, noting its inclusion among various locoregional interventional therapies, but did not provide specific efficacy data for iodine alone.
population_specificity: Patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

study_goal: The study does not focus on determining specific effects of iodine but mentions the author's early research interest in iodine metabolism.
results_summary: The abstract does not report any findings related to iodine's effects, as it primarily discusses lessons learned in medical education.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on medical education experiences).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on the use of gadolinium (Gd) as an alternative to iodine-based contrast media in patients with iodine allergies or severe renal failure requiring coronary or vascular procedures.
results_summary: The study highlights that iodine-based contrast media can cause severe allergies and renal issues, making gadolinium a potential alternative due to its different chemical structure and lack of cross-reactivity with iodine. The abstract suggests that Gd is commonly used in MRI and may be suitable for patients with iodine contraindications.
population_specificity: Patients with iodine allergies or severe renal failure requiring coronary or vascular procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether SWI (Susceptibility Weighted Imaging) could indicate the severity of hemodynamics in MMD (Moyamoya Disease) by evaluating the correlation between SWI stage and hemodynamics using SPECT with iodine-123 N-isopropyl-p-iodoamphetamine.
results_summary: The study found that higher SWI stages correlated with ischemic presentations in MMD and lower cerebral blood flow (CBF) and cerebrovascular reactivity (CVR) in the middle cerebral artery area, suggesting SWI could predict MMD severity.
population_specificity: 33 MMD patients (12 males, 21 females; age range 8-66 years), including asymptomatic, TIA, infarct, and hemorrhage cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (131-I) in postoperative management of differentiated thyroid cancer, including its indications, risk group stratification, and dosage considerations.
results_summary: The study highlights the importance of 131-I in adjuvant treatment and therapy for recurrent or metastatic thyroid cancer, with varying recommendations for dosage and patient preparation (low iodine diet, TSH stimulation). Guidelines differ on criteria for risk group classification and the necessity of preablative scintigraphy.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer, stratified into very low, low, and high-risk groups.
effective_dosage: Not specified (varies by risk group and guidelines).
interactions: Low iodine diet recommended; endogenous (thyroid hormone withdrawal) or exogenous (recombinant human TSH) stimulation required.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of radioactive iodine (radioiodine) therapy in treating primary hyperthyroidism, including its indications, contraindications, and safety considerations.
results_summary: The study found that radioiodine therapy is effective for treating hyperthyroidism, particularly in cases of recurrent Graves-Basedow disease and toxic nodules, but requires prior pharmacological normalization of thyroid function to avoid exacerbation. Absolute contraindications include pregnancy and lactation, while relative contraindications include suspected malignancy and age under 15.
population_specificity: Patients with primary hyperthyroidism, including Graves-Basedow disease, toxic nodules, and toxic goitre.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if administering iodide (127I) two days after radioiodine (131I) therapy could increase the effective half-life of 131I and improve therapeutic outcomes in hyperthyroid patients with low effective half-life.
results_summary: The study found that iodide administration significantly increased the effective half-life of 131I, leading to higher absorbed energy doses in thyroid tissue. This improved therapeutic outcomes, with 50% of Graves' disease and 93% of toxic nodular goitre patients achieving euthyroidism after one year.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroidism (Graves' disease or toxic nodular goitre) and low effective half-life of 131I (Teff < 3 days).
effective_dosage: 600 μg of iodide per day for 3 days, starting two days after 131I therapy.
study_duration: 3 days of iodide administration, with follow-up assessments at 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers were comparing the safety and efficacy of dronedarone (which lacks iodine) to amiodarone (which contains iodine) in treating atrial fibrillation, focusing on organ toxicity and antiarrhythmic effects.
results_summary: The study found that dronedarone, lacking iodine, avoids amiodarone's organ toxicity (e.g., thyroid and pulmonary effects) but may have lower antiarrhythmic efficacy. It is effective in preventing AF recurrence and reducing cardiovascular hospitalizations.
population_specificity: Patients with atrial fibrillation (paroxysmal, persistent, or permanent).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the impact of different subgingival irrigation solutions, including povidone-iodine, on treatment outcomes in chronic periodontitis patients after scaling and root planing.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine showed the highest clinical improvements and significantly reduced counts of specific periodontal pathogens, though no significant differences were observed in clinical results among the groups after 12 months.
population_specificity: 51 adult volunteers with generalized chronic periodontitis.
effective_dosage: 7.5% povidone-iodine for subgingival irrigation during SRP.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the risk factors for life-threatening hyponatremia as a complication of a prolonged low-iodine diet in patients preparing for radioiodine therapy.
results_summary: The study found that a prolonged low-iodine diet, elimination of salt, and thiazide diuretic use were risk factors for severe hyponatremia in elderly patients. The patient in the case study developed critical hyponatremia but recovered with appropriate management.
population_specificity: Elderly patients (older than 65 years) preparing for radioiodine therapy after thyroidectomy for papillary thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide guidelines for the safe and effective use of iodine-131 in treating hyperthyroidism and thyroid carcinoma.
results_summary: The guideline emphasizes maximizing efficacy and maintaining safety for iodine-131 therapy in hyperthyroidism and thyroid carcinoma, alongside other radiopharmaceuticals. It outlines indications but does not provide specific outcome data.
population_specificity: Physicians performing therapy with radiopharmaceuticals, particularly for hyperthyroidism and thyroid carcinoma patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic value of a new TSI bioassay for Graves' disease in a high iodine intake area and determine an optimal cut-off value.
results_summary: The study found that the Mc4-CHO bioassay had high sensitivity (97.0%) and specificity (95.9%) for diagnosing Graves' disease, with a proposed cut-off of 123.0 SRR%. TSI levels were significantly higher in Graves' disease patients compared to other groups, but no correlation was found with thyroid hormone levels.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease (untreated, treated, or in remission), Hashimoto's thyroiditis, subacute thyroiditis, postpartum thyroiditis, and euthyroid controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of lithium carbonate on radioiodine kinetics in the thyroid gland and its long-term impact on radioiodine therapy in hyperthyroid patients with low baseline radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU).
results_summary: Lithium carbonate significantly increased iodide uptake in the thyroid gland in most patients and improved radioiodine therapy outcomes in the first year, with similar results in subsequent years compared to the control group. It also reduced T(3), FT(3), T(4), and FT(4) levels without significantly altering TSH concentrations.
population_specificity: Hyperthyroid patients with low baseline RAIU (<30%), including those with Graves' disease, autonomous node, or multinodular goiter.
effective_dosage: 1.0 g/day of lithium carbonate for 6 days before radioiodine and 3 days thereafter.
study_duration: 9 days (6 days pre-treatment and 3 days post-radioiodine therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether iodine alone or in combination with T(4) was effective in reducing thyroid nodule and goiter volume compared to placebo or T(4) alone in patients with nodular goiter.
results_summary: Iodine alone showed a modest but non-significant reduction in nodule volume (-4.0%) compared to placebo, while the combination of iodine and T(4) resulted in a significant reduction (-17.3%). The combination therapy was superior to iodine alone but not significantly better than T(4) alone for goiter volume reduction.
population_specificity: Euthyroid patients aged 18-65 years with one or more thyroid nodules (minimal diameter 10 mm) in Germany.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of iodine-124 (124I) as a positron emitter for molecular imaging in PET radiochemistry and its applications in clinical and preclinical studies.
results_summary: The study highlights iodine-124's long half-life (4.2 days) and well-characterized radiochemistry, making it suitable for investigating slow pharmacokinetic processes in PET imaging. It also reviews the production and labeling of various compounds, from small molecules to nanoparticles, for molecular imaging purposes.
population_specificity: Clinical nuclear medicine and small animal PET imaging studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the appropriate duration of a low-iodine diet (LID) to reduce urine iodine excretion effectively in preparation for radioactive iodine therapy (RAIT) in high iodine intake areas.
results_summary: The study found that one week of a strict LID was sufficient to reduce urine iodine excretion below the cut-off levels, with significant decreases observed by day 6 for I/Cr ratio and day 3 for simple iodine concentration. Morning spot-urine iodine levels on days 7 and 14 were significantly lower than baseline.
population_specificity: 19 patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review established and emerging molecular nuclear therapies, including I-131, for treating various types of thyroid cancer.
results_summary: I-131 is highly effective for differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) but ineffective for other thyroid cancer types and some dedifferentiated DTC tumors. Experimental approaches like re-induction of NIS expression show promise for treating anaplastic and dedifferentiated DTC.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer (DTC, MTC, ATC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether an iodine-based skin preparation followed by a cyanoacrylate-based skin sealant reduces microbial contamination and surgical site infections compared to iodine-based skin preparation alone.
results_summary: The study found that the skin sealant group had lower microbial counts at surgical sites and a 35.3% relative risk reduction in surgical site infections compared to the control group, with an even greater reduction (83.3%) in obese patients.
population_specificity: Adults scheduled for elective coronary artery bypass graft surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop evidence-based clinical guidelines for the management of thyrotoxicosis, including the use of radioactive iodine and other treatments.
results_summary: The study provided 100 evidence-based recommendations for managing thyrotoxicosis, including the use of radioactive iodine, antithyroid drugs, and surgery, emphasizing current and optimal medical practices.
population_specificity: Patients with thyrotoxicosis, including those with Graves' hyperthyroidism, toxic multinodular goiter, toxic adenoma, and specific populations like children, adolescents, and pregnant patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost-effectiveness and outcomes of cervical cancer screening methods, including visual inspection with acetic acid (VIA) and Lugol's iodine (VIA/VILI), versus careHPV testing in rural China.
results_summary: The study found that VIA/VILI was more effective than VIA alone but less effective than careHPV testing in reducing cervical cancer incidence and mortality. The optimal age range for once-lifetime screening was 35-50 years.
population_specificity: Women in rural China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the quality and accuracy of three clinical imaging methods (MS-CT, C-arm CT, FP-CT) for visualizing small metallic stents filled with iodine contrast, using MicroCT as a reference standard.
results_summary: The study found that MS-CT overestimated strut dimensions and underestimated lumen diameter due to blooming effects, while C-arm CT and FP-CT more accurately represented stent struts. The stent lumen was 30% underestimated by MS-CT compared to MicroCT.
population_specificity: Not applicable (phantom study with a stent in a polytetrafluoroethylene tube).
effective_dosage: Nondiluted iodine contrast (specific concentration not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic indications, usefulness, and methods of treatment with (131)I-Lipiodol for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: (131)I-Lipiodol is effective in treating HCC with portal thrombosis and as an adjuvant to surgery, performing at least as well as chemoembolization with better tolerability. It is particularly useful for tumors smaller than 6cm in cases of severe liver dysfunction.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma, including those with portal thrombosis or post-resection cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the current iodine status of the UK population, focusing on schoolgirls aged 14-15 years, to determine if iodine deficiency is prevalent.
results_summary: The study found that the UK population, particularly schoolgirls, exhibits mild to moderate iodine deficiency, with 51% showing mild deficiency and 16% moderate deficiency. Low iodine levels were associated with seasonal sampling, geographical location, low milk intake, and high egg intake.
population_specificity: Schoolgirls aged 14-15 years from nine UK centers.
study_duration: Data collected in June-July 2009 and November-December 2009.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of real-time PCR versus microscopic examination (including iodine-stained smears) for detecting E. histolytica in stool samples.
results_summary: Real-time PCR detected E. histolytica in 52% of samples, outperforming microscopy (40%). No cross-reactivity with other parasites was observed.
population_specificity: 40 symptomatic patients (20 with dysentery, 20 without) and 10 samples with other parasitic infections (Giardia lamblia, Cryptosporidium parvum).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the surgical outcomes of robotic-assisted versus conventional endoscopic thyroidectomy in patients with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC).
results_summary: Robotic thyroidectomy showed advantages in surgical completeness (more central nodes retrieved) and advanced tumor/nodal status detection, though transient hypocalcemia was more frequent. Both methods had similar short-term recurrence rates (1-year follow-up).
population_specificity: Patients with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC) (n=1150).
study_duration: Retrospective analysis from November 2001 to July 2009 (follow-up: 1 year).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iodine 131 in nuclear medicine for diagnosing and treating thyroid diseases, including advancements in imaging techniques and evolving treatment guidelines.
results_summary: The study highlights that iodine 131 has been a cornerstone in thyroid disease management, with recent advancements like SPECT/CT and PET/CT improving detection and localization accuracy. Treatment guidelines emphasize balancing disease recurrence risks and radiation exposure.
population_specificity: Patients with benign and malignant thyroid disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vaginal preparation with povidone-iodine reduces post-caesarean infection rates, specifically endometritis.
results_summary: Vaginal preparation with povidone-iodine significantly reduced the incidence of post-caesarean endometritis (1.4% vs. 2.5% in controls) but showed no significant effect on febrile morbidity or wound infection. The adjusted odds ratio for endometritis was 0.03 (95% CI: 0.008-0.7).
population_specificity: 568 patients undergoing caesarean section, divided into treatment (284) and control (284) groups.
effective_dosage: Two 4 × 4 cm sponge sticks saturated with povidone-iodine solution, rotated in the vagina for 30 seconds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and outcomes of salvage robot-assisted radical prostatectomy (sRARP) in patients with recurrent prostate cancer after radiation therapy, including cases involving iodine-125 brachytherapy.
results_summary: The study found that sRARP was technically challenging but feasible, with low early complication rates (20%) and encouraging early continence rates (71.4%). Biochemical recurrence occurred in 28.6% of patients at a median follow-up of 4.6 months.
population_specificity: Patients with biopsy-proven recurrent prostate cancer after definitive radiotherapy (external-beam radiation, iodine-125 brachytherapy, proton beam therapy, or combined treatments).
effective_dosage: Not specified (interstitial radioactive 125-iodine brachytherapy dosage not detailed).

study_goal: To compare the efficacy and cost-effectiveness of high (150 microCi/gm) and low (100 microCi/gm) dose regimens of I-131 treatment in patients with hyperthyroidism.
results_summary: The high dose regimen eliminated hyperthyroidism significantly faster (259.6 days vs. 305.5 days) and had a lower persistence rate of hyperthyroidism (30% vs. 48%) at one year compared to the low dose regimen. The low dose group incurred higher average total costs for persistent hyperthyroid patients.
population_specificity: 150 patients with proven hyperthyroidism (74 high dose, 76 low dose).
effective_dosage: High dose: 150 microCi/gm; low dose: 100 microCi/gm.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prognostic value of thyroglobulin levels early after total thyroidectomy, before iodine ablation, in patients with non-medullary thyroid carcinoma.
results_summary: Higher baseline thyroglobulin levels were associated with male gender, larger tumor size, and more extensive disease, and were predictive of persistent disease. A thyroglobulin level <10 ng/ml indicated a low probability of persistent disease.
population_specificity: Patients with non-medullary thyroid carcinoma who underwent total thyroidectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the properties of MTAD as an endodontic irrigant, comparing it to other irrigants like iodine potassium iodide, focusing on antimicrobial activity, smear layer removal, and biocompatibility.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that iodine potassium iodide is one of several endodontic irrigants with advantages and limitations, but the study primarily reviews MTAD's properties, not providing specific results for iodine.
population_specificity: Not specified (general endodontic therapy context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate novel treatments, including multi-kinase inhibitors, for iodine-refractory differentiated or medullary thyroid carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that multi-kinase inhibitors like axitinib, sorafenib, motesanib, and XL-184 showed promising clinical responses and disease stabilization in thyroid cancer, targeting genetic alterations such as RET/PTC rearrangements and B-Raf mutations.
population_specificity: Patients with iodine-refractory differentiated or medullary thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic and therapeutic approaches for thyroid nodules and multinodular goiter, including the use of radioactive iodine.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine is safe and effective for treating multinodular goiter, particularly in symptomatic patients, though surgery remains the primary option for malignant or suspicious nodules. Periodic follow-up with ultrasound and palpation is recommended for monitoring.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid nodules or multinodular goiter.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review congenital hypothyroidism caused by defects in thyroid hormone synthesis, focusing on genetic mutations and the clinical implications of molecular diagnoses.
results_summary: The study found that genetic defects in thyroid hormone synthesis pathways, including iodide transport and organification, lead to congenital hypothyroidism. Molecular diagnosis aids in genetic counseling and identifies patients who may benefit from iodine supplementation.
population_specificity: Individuals with congenital hypothyroidism due to thyroid dyshormonogenesis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various prophylactic regimens, including 2.5% povidone-iodine solution, for preventing ophthalmia neonatorum in newborns.
results_summary: The study found that 1% tetracycline solutions showed better outcomes despite the risk of selecting drug-resistant bacteria, while nitrate solutions could cause chemical conjunctivitis. Povidone-iodine was mentioned as a recommended prophylactic option, but no specific efficacy data were highlighted for it.
population_specificity: Neonates (first month of life)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of iodine-based dual-energy CT (DECT) in assessing perfusion defect size as a predictor of right heart strain and patient outcomes in acute pulmonary embolism.
results_summary: The study found that perfusion defect size on DECT iodine maps correlated with right heart strain and predicted adverse outcomes, such as death or readmission, in acute pulmonary embolism patients. D-dimer levels showed mild correlation with perfusion defect size.
population_specificity: 53 patients with acute pulmonary embolism who underwent DECT pulmonary angiography.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antimicrobial substantivity of different irrigants, including 1% povidone iodine, in instrumented root canals.
results_summary: 1% povidone iodine demonstrated antimicrobial substantivity, though it was less effective than 2% chlorhexidine gluconate, which lasted up to 72 hours. The study concluded that 2% chlorhexidine should be preferred as a final rinse irrigant in endodontic treatment.
population_specificity: Instrumented root canals (specific human population not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the genetic and clinical features of congenital hypothyroidism caused by defects in the peroxide generator system, including the role of iodine intake.
results_summary: The study identified mutations in DUOX2 and DUOXA2 genes as contributors to congenital hypothyroidism, with phenotypic variability potentially influenced by iodine intake, among other factors.
population_specificity: Newborns with congenital hypothyroidism, particularly those with dyshormonogenesis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potency of tetra-halogenated benzimidazoles, particularly iodine-substituted compounds, as CK2 inhibitors for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that replacing chlorine with iodine in tetra-halogenated benzimidazoles increased their potency as CK2 inhibitors, which are effective in inducing apoptosis in cancer cells without affecting normal cells. The efficacy of these inhibitors relies on hydrophobic interactions within a specific cavity in CK2.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro) and potential clinical applications for advanced solid tumors, Castelman's disease, and multiple myeloma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop evidence-based clinical guidelines for the management of thyrotoxicosis, including the use of radioactive iodine and other treatments.
results_summary: The study provided 100 evidence-based recommendations for managing thyrotoxicosis, including the use of radioactive iodine, antithyroid drugs, and surgery, but did not specifically report on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with thyrotoxicosis, including those with Graves' hyperthyroidism, toxic multinodular goiter, toxic adenoma, and other causes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the success of iodine-131 treatment for Graves' disease in patients with no pretreatment, pretreatment with methimazole (MMI) stopped one week before treatment, and MMI continued until treatment.
results_summary: Iodine-131 treatment was equally effective in patients without MMI pretreatment and those who discontinued MMI one week before treatment (96.6% and 96% success rates, respectively), but significantly less effective (63.8%) in patients who continued MMI until treatment. The absorbed dose of iodine-131 was higher in the first two groups compared to the third.
population_specificity: 156 patients with Graves' disease.

study_goal: To determine if a preoperative skin preparation protocol using povidone-iodine (scrub followed by paint) reduces postcesarean delivery infections compared to iodine paint alone.
results_summary: The SCRUB+PAINT protocol significantly reduced major puerperal infections (38% reduction) and composite wound infections (31% reduction) compared to PAINT alone, with statistically significant results.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing cesarean delivery (n=2,143).
effective_dosage: Povidone-iodine (13%) scrub followed by povidone-iodine (10%) paint.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the benefits and risks of prophylactic central lymph node dissection (CLND) in patients with clinically node-negative papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC).
results_summary: Prophylactic CLND significantly reduced postoperative thyroglobulin levels but did not decrease short-term locoregional recurrence rates. The risk of permanent hypocalcemia was higher in the CLND group, though not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients with clinically node-negative papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC).
effective_dosage: Not specified (surgical intervention, not iodine dosage).
study_duration: Follow-up period included 3-year locoregional control rates.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical potential of (124)I-PET/CT in diagnosing and managing differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), focusing on staging recurrent/residual disease and pretherapy dosimetry.
results_summary: The study found that (124)I-PET/CT improves localization of iodine-avid lesions with low radiation exposure and enhances detection of non-iodine-avid lesions when combined with FDG-PET/CT. It also demonstrated that pretherapy dosimetry can lead to safer, more effective radioiodine administration and earlier multimodal interventions compared to standard protocols.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the 2009 American Thyroid Association guidelines for managing thyroid nodules and differentiated thyroid cancer, including the use of iodine in treatment and surveillance.
results_summary: The study highlights updated guidelines for thyroid nodule evaluation, surgical treatment, radioactive iodine ablation, and long-term surveillance, emphasizing risk stratification and evidence-based decision-making.
population_specificity: Patients with benign and malignant thyroid diseases, including thyroid nodules and differentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review changing treatment paradigms for thyroid cancer, including the role of I¹³¹ ablation and newer therapies like multikinase inhibitors.
results_summary: The study found that I¹³¹ remnant ablation may not benefit low-risk patients with small tumors, while multikinase inhibitors show promise for aggressive, non-iodine-avid thyroid cancer. Risk stratification has shifted treatment toward individualized approaches.
population_specificity: Thyroid cancer patients, particularly those with low-risk or high-risk recurrent/progressive disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the incidence of hypothyroidism after radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment for hyperthyroidism and assess the relationship between pretreatment RAI uptake, treatment dose, and subsequent hypothyroidism development.
results_summary: The study found that 70% of Graves' disease patients developed hypothyroidism post-RAI compared to 42% in toxic nodular goiter patients, though cure rates were similar. Neither RAI dose nor pretreatment uptake predicted hypothyroidism likelihood.
population_specificity: Patients treated with RAI for hyperthyroidism (Graves' disease or toxic nodular goiter) between 1995 and 2000.
effective_dosage: Not specified (doses varied by condition but exact amounts not detailed).
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up period not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and dosimetric effects of outpatient radioiodine therapy (iodine-131) for thyroid cancer on family members and living environments.
results_summary: The study found that outpatient radioiodine therapy with doses up to 7.4 GBq resulted in low radiation exposure to caregivers (mean 0.27 mSv) and minimal environmental contamination, well below international safety thresholds. The procedure was deemed safe when supervised by qualified professionals.
population_specificity: 100 thyroid cancer patients treated on an outpatient basis, along with their caregivers and living environments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical benefits of radioactive iodine (RAI) and external beam radiation therapy (EBRT) in managing differentiated thyroid cancer and assess their roles in adjuvant therapy and treatment of gross residual disease.
results_summary: The study found that RAI is effective as an adjuvant therapy and for treatment in properly selected patients, while EBRT improves locoregional control and provides palliative benefits in high-risk patients. However, recommendations are based on retrospective cohort studies due to a lack of prospective randomized trials.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer, particularly those requiring adjuvant therapy or treatment for gross residual disease.

study_goal: To compare the efficacy and safety of povidone iodine 2.5% solution versus tetracycline 1% ointment in preventing ophthalmia neonatorum in neonates.
results_summary: Povidone iodine was associated with a higher incidence of both noninfective and infective ophthalmia neonatorum compared to tetracycline, suggesting toxicity to the ocular surface in neonates. Tetracycline was marginally more effective against infective ON.
population_specificity: 394 full-term neonates.
study_duration: Not specified (outcomes measured within the first 3 days post-treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the nutritional and health status of infants and young children in the Sahel, including the role of iodine in preventing micronutrient deficiencies.
results_summary: The study summarized international guidelines on optimal infant and young child nutrition, which included iodine as a key micronutrient for preventing deficiencies, but did not provide specific results on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Infants and young children in six Sahel countries (Burkina Faso, Chad, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, and Senegal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanism of action and clinical indications of the tositumomab and iodine I 131 tositumomab (Bexaar) therapeutic regimen for non-Hodgkin lymphoma.
results_summary: The study reviewed the regimen's targeting of monoclonal antibodies against the CD20 antigen in non-Hodgkin lymphoma, highlighting its clinical applications and mechanism of action.
population_specificity: Patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma expressing the CD20 antigen.

study_goal: The researchers analyzed the electrophysiological, pharmacological, efficacy, and safety properties of dronedarone (an amiodarone-like drug lacking iodine) in patients with atrial fibrillation.
results_summary: The study found that dronedarone, which lacks iodine, was effective for rhythm and rate control in atrial fibrillation and had a better safety profile than amiodarone, avoiding thyroid, pulmonary, and neurological toxicity. However, it did not specifically evaluate iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with paroxysmal, persistent, or nonpermanent atrial fibrillation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical effectiveness of iodine-125 seed-loaded radioactive stents versus covered stents alone in treating malignant esophageal strictures.
results_summary: The iodine-125 seed-loaded stents significantly improved median survival (11 vs. 4.9 months) compared to covered stents alone, with similar dysphagia improvement but no significant difference in complication or reintervention rates.
population_specificity: Patients with malignant esophageal strictures (28 in the iodine-125 group, 30 in the control group).
study_duration: Follow-up duration not explicitly stated, but survival outcomes were tracked (median 11 vs. 4.9 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) on cardiac autonomic function, using iodine-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine scintigraphy to assess cardiac sympathetic function.
results_summary: CRT improved sympathetic function, as evidenced by increased delayed heart/mediastinum (H/M) ratio and reduced H/M washout rate. Responders to CRT had higher baseline delayed H/M ratios and lower washout rates compared to nonresponders.
population_specificity: 45 consecutive patients with heart failure receiving CRT devices and 20 age-matched healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop recommendations for radiation safety in patients treated with ¹³¹I for thyroid diseases, ensuring safety for patients, family members, and the public.
results_summary: The study compiled radiation safety guidelines based on regulatory standards and institutional practices, providing tables for precaution durations and checklists for patient assessment. It emphasized the need for informed physicians and patients to achieve radiation safety post-treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid diseases (hyperthyroidism and thyroid cancer) treated with ¹³¹I.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess long-term vascular changes and morbidity associated with interstitial radiotherapy using transient Iodine-125 implants in children with low-grade hypothalamic gliomas.
results_summary: Six out of 13 patients developed cerebral vasculopathies, with only one showing symptoms of intermittent cerebral ischemia. The study suggests tumor encasement, surgical damage, and brachytherapy may contribute to vascular changes, but the exact etiology remains unclear.
population_specificity: Children with low-grade hypothalamic gliomas, including four with neurofibromatosis type 1.
study_duration: Follow-up occurred 3 to 13 years after treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate dosimetry-based approaches (blood dosimetry and lesion-based dosimetry) for optimizing safety and efficacy in radioactive iodine therapy for differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) patients.
results_summary: The study found that dosimetry-based approaches could replace fixed-activity regimens, potentially improving safety by avoiding overdosing and enhancing efficacy by tailoring treatment to individual patients. A simplified blood dosimetry method and a new concept for assessing patient-specific radiation sensitivity were introduced.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) post-surgery or with iodine-avid metastases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine-soaked gauze versus oxidized regenerated cellulose (ORC) in reducing microbial load and infection rates in "dirty" surgical wounds.
results_summary: The study found no clinically evident infections in either group, but iodine-soaked gauze showed reduced bacterial contamination in only 25% of patients compared to 66% in the ORC group.
population_specificity: 98 patients who underwent intestinal recanalization procedures with stoma as the surgical site.
study_duration: Swabs were taken before wound packing and on the 2nd and 3rd postoperative day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of (124)I PET/CT for accurate dosimetry in (131)I radiopharmaceutical therapies and discuss factors affecting image quantification accuracy.
results_summary: The study highlights the importance of accurate activity concentration determination in (124)I PET/CT for lesion dosimetry, identifies challenges like prompt gamma effects, and reviews correction methods. It also addresses special issues such as shine-through artifacts and transmission-contamination effects.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing (131)I radiopharmaceutical therapies for cancer treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess iodine deficiency prevalence in pregnant women and evaluate hygiene-dietetic habits related to iodine intake and smoking during pregnancy.
results_summary: The study planned to determine iodine deficiency prevalence and associated factors during pregnancy, with an intervention involving group education on healthy habits and iodine nutrition. Results were not explicitly stated in the abstract.
population_specificity: Pregnant women over 17 years in their first trimester attending primary care centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether the Egr1 promoter could enhance Iodine-stimulated human NIS (hNIS) transgene expression in malignant glioma cells compared to the CMV promoter.
results_summary: The study found that Bac-CMV-hNIS-transfected cells showed higher hNIS protein expression and iodine accumulation than Bac-Egr1-hNIS-transfected cells, though the latter exhibited some Iodine-stimulated activity. Rapid iodine efflux was observed in both groups.
population_specificity: Human malignant glioma U87 cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether a combined treatment of LAC and L-Carnitine improved endocrine and metabolic pathways in patients with functional hypothalamic amenorrhea (FHA).
results_summary: The treatment increased LH plasma levels and decreased cortisol and amylase levels, particularly in hypo-LH patients, indicating reduced stress-induced adrenal activity and improved neuroendocrine function.
population_specificity: 27 patients with functional hypothalamic amenorrhea (FHA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of L-Carnitine and its derivatives on endothelial dysfunction and platelet aggregation in pathological conditions.
results_summary: The study found that L-Carnitine and its derivatives show preventive effects on endothelial dysfunction and platelet aggregation in vitro and in animal models, but more clinical trials are needed to confirm its clinical importance.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of in vitro, in vivo, and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of L-Carnitine and vitamin B complex in treating asparaginase-induced hepatotoxicity in a patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
results_summary: The study found that L-Carnitine and vitamin B complex successfully restored hepatic function in a patient with acute liver injury caused by pegaspargase, with recovery achieved after 8 days of treatment. The abstract also suggests reviewing literature to recommend a potential treatment regimen for similar cases.
population_specificity: A single patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia experiencing asparaginase-induced hepatotoxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether acetyl-L-carnitine is effective and safe for preventing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that acetyl-L-carnitine is not recommended for preventing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy due to a possibility of harm. No strong evidence supports its use for managing breast cancer treatment-related side effects.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic potential of L-carnitine and acetyl-L-carnitine (ALCAR) for neuroprotection in disorders involving brain injury, including hypoxia-ischemia, traumatic brain injury, and Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: Preclinical studies showed that L-carnitine and ALCAR improve energy status, reduce oxidative stress, and prevent cell death in models of brain injury. ALCAR administration after brain injury in rat pups improved long-term functional outcomes, including memory.
population_specificity: Models of adult, neonatal, and pediatric brain injury (including rat pups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) as a therapy for improving symptoms of diabetic neuropathy and its broader neurological benefits.
results_summary: ALC demonstrated cytoprotective, antioxidant, and antiapoptotic effects in the nervous system, facilitated nerve regeneration, reduced glutamate concentration for analgesia, and improved neuronal membrane functionality and axonal transport. It also enhanced nerve growth factor responsiveness, suggesting benefits for various neurological and psychiatric conditions.
population_specificity: Elderly diabetic patients with neuropathy and broader neurological/psychiatric conditions (e.g., mood disorders, dementias, Alzheimer's, Parkinson's).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of organic ion transporters, including OCTN2, in astrocytes and their potential as pharmacological targets for CNS diseases, with a focus on carnitine/acetyl-L-carnitine transport.
results_summary: The study found that OCTN2 facilitates cellular entry of carnitine/acetyl-L-carnitine in astrocytes, suggesting its potential role in CNS function and as a target for CNS disease interventions.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on astrocyte mechanisms in general).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects of L-carnitine (LC) on sperm membrane integrity during cryopreservation and compare its efficacy with pentoxifylline (PT).
results_summary: LC supplementation increased the percentage of noncapacitated and acrosomal intact spermatozoa compared to control and PT-treated samples, and reduced acrosomal-reacted spermatozoa. While LC did not improve motility, it protected plasma membrane and acrosomal integrity better than PT.
population_specificity: Thirty normal human semen samples prepared by swim-up procedure.
study_duration: 30-minute incubation before cryopreservation, thawed after 48 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of L-carnitine in primary and secondary prevention of anthracycline-related cardiomyopathy in childhood cancer survivors.
results_summary: The study identified alterations in L-carnitine levels in cancer survivors and suggested a potential role in prevention during treatment and improving function post-treatment, though further investigation is needed.
population_specificity: Long-term survivors of childhood cancer with anthracycline-related cardiovascular complications.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of L-Carnitine on body mass index and overall survival in advanced pancreatic cancer patients.
results_summary: L-Carnitine was found to increase body mass index and improve overall survival in advanced pancreatic cancer patients. Adverse effects of supplementation were rare and mild.
population_specificity: Advanced pancreatic cancer patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether oral L-carnitine supplementation could protect against delayed graft function (DGF) in kidney transplant recipients from deceased donors.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in DGF incidence between L-carnitine and placebo groups, but 3-month graft loss was lower in the L-carnitine group.
population_specificity: Patients older than 14 years undergoing their first kidney transplantation from a deceased donor.
effective_dosage: 3 g of oral L-carnitine daily, divided into 3 doses.
study_duration: 4 consecutive days (starting the day before transplantation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether L-carnitine supplementation improves reverse remodeling in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass graft surgery.
results_summary: L-carnitine supplementation did not show additional benefits in reverse remodeling compared to controls, but within the L-carnitine group, there was a significant increase in left ventricle ejection fraction and reductions in systolic and diastolic diameters.
population_specificity: Patients with ischemic heart failure who underwent coronary artery bypass graft surgery (mean age 58.1 ± 10.5 years, 93% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits of L-arginine (not L-Carnitine) in treating hyperammonemia caused by valproate overdose.
results_summary: The study found that L-arginine reduced ammonia levels in all five cases, with significant decreases observed. L-Carnitine was used in some cases but its effects were not the primary focus of the study.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperammonemia (ammonia >80 μg/dL) and symptoms of valproate overdose (drowsiness, coma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of L-carnitine for enhancing cognitive function in cognitively healthy individuals.
results_summary: The study found no evidence that L-carnitine improves cognitive functions like reaction time, vigilance, or memory in healthy adults. Adverse effects were minimal and non-serious, but the evidence was of very low quality due to poor reporting and limited data.
population_specificity: Young adults without cognitive impairment.
study_duration: Three days (one trial), duration not reported for the other.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of 10-week L-carnitine supplementation on frailty status, biomarkers, physical function, cognition, and nutritional status in prefrail older adults.
results_summary: L-carnitine supplementation significantly improved Frailty Index scores and hand grip test performance in prefrail older adults, suggesting favorable effects on functional status and fatigue.
population_specificity: Prefrail older adults in Klang Valley, Malaysia (n=50, randomized into L-carnitine and placebo groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effect of L-carnitine/simvastatin co-administration versus simvastatin monotherapy on Lp(a) levels in subjects with mixed hyperlipidemia and elevated Lp(a).
results_summary: L-carnitine/simvastatin co-administration significantly reduced Lp(a) levels (-19.4%) compared to simvastatin monotherapy (-6.7%). Both groups showed similar reductions in total cholesterol, LDL-C, apo B, and TAG.
population_specificity: Subjects with LDL-C >160 mg/dL, TAG >150 mg/dL, and Lp(a) >20 mg/dL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence supporting the use of L-Carnitine for painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy.
results_summary: The abstract states that L-Carnitine lacks high-quality evidence to support its use for painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy, implying minimal or no demonstrated efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of L-carnitine supplementation on serum inflammatory mediators and pain in females with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: L-Carnitine significantly reduced serum IL-1β and MMP-1 levels and improved pain scores (52.67% reduction) compared to placebo (21.82%). No significant changes were observed in hs-CRP or MMP-13 levels.
population_specificity: Females with mild to moderate knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether L-Carnitine could restore long-chain fatty acid oxidation in mitochondria to address ATP crisis and multiorgan failure during severe influenza infection.
results_summary: The study found that L-Carnitine, in combination with bezafibrate, effectively restored long-chain fatty acid oxidation in mitochondria, particularly benefiting patients with influenza-associated encephalopathy who had specific carnitine palmitoyltransferase II variants.
population_specificity: Patients with severe influenza, particularly those with underlying risk factors and influenza-associated encephalopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether L-Carnitine supplementation could alleviate fatigue symptoms in hypothyroid patients despite adequate thyroid hormone replacement.
results_summary: L-Carnitine significantly reduced mental fatigue scores compared to placebo, with notable improvements in younger patients and those with higher free T3 levels. While physical fatigue and overall fatigue severity scores did not change significantly, a higher percentage of patients in the L-Carnitine group reported improvements across all fatigue measures compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Hypothyroid patients (60 participants, 3 males, 57 females, mean age 50.0 ± 9.2 years) experiencing persistent fatigue despite thyroid hormone replacement, including post-thyroidectomy patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and discontinuation rates of various antidepressants, including acetyl-l-carnitine, for treating persistent depressive disorder (PDD).
results_summary: Acetyl-l-carnitine showed lower rates of adverse events and treatment discontinuations compared to other antidepressants, suggesting better safety and tolerability.
population_specificity: Adults with persistent depressive disorder (PDD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether L-Carnitine supplementation affects leptin levels, adiponectin levels, and body weight in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found that L-Carnitine supplementation (1 g/day for 12 weeks) did not significantly affect leptin levels, adiponectin levels, or body weight in hemodialysis patients. Adiponectin levels increased significantly only in the control group.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the lipid-lowering effects of L-Carnitine supplementation (1000 mg/d) in coronary artery disease (CAD) patients.
results_summary: L-Carnitine supplementation significantly increased HDL-C and Apo-A1 levels, slightly reduced TG levels, and showed no significant changes in other lipids. The lipid-lowering effect may be linked to its antioxidant ability, as evidenced by increased SOD activity.
population_specificity: CAD patients with at least 50% stenosis of one major coronary artery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) with methylcobalamin (MC) in treating diabetic peripheral neuropathy.
results_summary: ALC was found to be as effective as MC in reducing neuropathy symptom and disability scores, with no significant difference in adverse events between the two groups. Neurophysiological parameters also improved similarly in both groups.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients with abnormal nerve conduction test results.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of L-Carnitine as part of dietary interventions and supplements in the management of hepatic encephalopathy (HE).
results_summary: The abstract mentions acetyl-L-carnitine as one of the dietary interventions reviewed for HE management, but specific efficacy results for L-Carnitine are not detailed. The study broadly concludes that HE management remains a clinical challenge despite numerous treatment options.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatic encephalopathy, particularly those with portal hypertension and cirrhosis.

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically address L-Carnitine; it discusses general nutritional supplementation in cancer patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not report findings on L-Carnitine.
population_specificity: Cancer patients using nutritional supplements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current state of knowledge on the effects of acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) in the nervous system, focusing on its neuroprotective, neurotrophic, and neuromodulatory properties.
results_summary: The study found that ALC supplementation has neuroprotective, neurotrophic, antidepressive, and analgesic effects, along with antioxidant and anti-apoptotic activity. It also positively impacts mitochondrial metabolism and shows promise in treating aging and neurodegenerative diseases by slowing mental deterioration.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of ALC effects in the nervous system).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Acetyl-L-carnitine (ALCAR) could improve nerve regeneration and functional recovery in severe carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS) patients following surgery.
results_summary: The abstract describes a planned pilot study but does not report results, as it appears to be a protocol for future research. The study will assess ALCAR's effects on motor unit number estimation (MUNE) and other secondary outcomes post-surgery.
population_specificity: Adult patients with severe CTS confirmed by nerve conduction studies and motor unit loss in the thenar muscles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential role of L-Carnitine in treating pulmonary hypertension (PH) associated with thalassemia syndromes.
results_summary: The abstract mentions limited evidence for L-Carnitine's use in treating PH in thalassemia, suggesting it is not a well-established therapy. No specific outcomes or benefits are detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with β-thalassemia major or intermedia who develop pulmonary hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of L-Carnitine supplementation in addressing sexual, reproductive, and gonadal abnormalities in patients with epilepsy.
results_summary: The study suggests that L-Carnitine supplementation may be beneficial for patients with epilepsy experiencing sexual and reproductive dysfunction, alongside other interventions like androgen therapy and psychotherapy. However, the abstract does not provide specific data on L-Carnitine's effectiveness.
population_specificity: Patients with epilepsy, particularly those with sexual, reproductive, or gonadal abnormalities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how lean-seafood and nonseafood diets affect urinary metabolites related to mitochondrial lipid and energy metabolism, including L-Carnitine.
results_summary: The lean-seafood diet reduced urinary excretion of L-Carnitine and related metabolites, suggesting a potential increase in lipid catabolism. No adverse effects or direct efficacy of L-Carnitine supplementation were reported.
population_specificity: 20 healthy subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether L-carnitine supplementation induces seizures in patients on valproic acid (VPA) therapy, contradicting unsubstantiated warnings in product monographs.
results_summary: The study found no evidence linking L-carnitine supplementation to seizures in patients on VPA therapy, contradicting unreferenced concerns in product monographs. It concluded that L-carnitine can be safely considered for patients with hypocarnitinemia or hyperammonemic encephalopathy on VPA.
population_specificity: Patients on valproic acid (VPA) therapy, particularly those with hypocarnitinemia or hyperammonemic encephalopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pharmacological effects and mechanisms of meldonium, focusing on its l-carnitine lowering effect and its implications for treating cardiovascular and metabolic conditions.
results_summary: The study found that meldonium regulates energy metabolism by lowering l-carnitine levels, which shifts cellular energy homeostasis toward glucose metabolism and reduces l-carnitine-related metabolites like long-chain acylcarnitines and trimethylamine-N-oxide. These changes were associated with potential benefits for heart failure, myocardial infarction, arrhythmia, atherosclerosis, and diabetes.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of pharmacological mechanisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if lactate clearance could serve as a surrogate marker for changes in microcirculatory blood flow in patients with septic shock treated with L-Carnitine.
results_summary: The study found no association between lactate clearance and changes in microcirculatory blood flow, suggesting lactate clearance may not be a reliable surrogate marker for microcirculatory changes in septic shock patients.
population_specificity: Patients with vasopressor-dependent septic shock.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify metabolites, including oleoyl-L-carnitine, that could discriminate between pancreatic cancer patients and healthy controls.
results_summary: Oleoyl-L-carnitine was identified as one of the metabolites highly discriminating between pancreatic cancer patients and healthy subjects, suggesting its potential as a biomarker. The study did not evaluate L-carnitine's therapeutic effects but highlighted its role in metabolic profiling.
population_specificity: 40 pancreatic cancer patients and 40 healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical significance of elevated C14:1 levels (tetradecenoyl-L-carnitine) in newborn screening and its association with VLCADD-like symptoms in a New Zealand population.
results_summary: The study found no significant increase in clinically significant childhood disease among children with elevated C14:1 levels (0.9-2.4 μmol/L), suggesting minimal risk. The c.1226C>T variant was associated with elevated C14:1 levels but not with adverse clinical outcomes.
population_specificity: Newborns in New Zealand (2006-2013), predominantly of Maori or Pacific ethnicity.
study_duration: Follow-up period ranged from 6 months to 7 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effect of L-carnitine on myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury (MIRI) during valve replacement surgery and its potential mechanism.
results_summary: L-carnitine reduced postoperative serum enzyme levels and apoptotic index compared to the control group, with higher Bcl-2 and lower Bax expression, suggesting a protective effect against MIRI. No significant differences were observed between the two L-carnitine dosage groups.
population_specificity: 90 patients undergoing valve replacement surgery under cardiopulmonary bypass.
effective_dosage: 3 g/L and 6 g/L in crystalloid cardioplegic solution.
study_duration: Administered during surgery (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of Acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) among other therapies for treating neuropathic pain.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that ALC, along with other therapies, has shown encouraging results in treating neuropathic pain, though randomized controlled trials are still needed for confirmation.
population_specificity: Patients with neuropathic pain (specific population details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of acetyl-L-carnitine in preventing or treating chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).
results_summary: The study found that acetyl-L-carnitine may worsen CIPN, indicating a negative effect rather than a beneficial one. No positive outcomes were reported for L-Carnitine in this context.
population_specificity: Cancer patients experiencing or at risk for chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the molecular, biochemical, and structural properties of CPT1C and discuss its potential roles in brain function and cancer.
results_summary: The study found that CPT1C, despite minimal catalytic activity with L-Carnitine, may act as a lipid metabolism sensor in neurons, impacting ceramide and triacylglycerol metabolism, and could be a promising target in cancer treatment due to its expression in virulent tumor cells.
population_specificity: Neurons, global knock-out mice, and humans with hereditary spastic paraplegia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if whey protein could reduce the carbohydrate load needed to stimulate insulin-mediated muscle carnitine accretion when combined with L-carnitine supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that carbohydrate consumption alone increased forearm carnitine balance, but this effect was blunted when combined with protein. Carbohydrate+protein consumption resulted in higher plasma carnitine levels compared to control or carbohydrate alone.
population_specificity: Seven healthy men (mean age 24 ± 5 years, BMI 23 ± 3 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: 4.5 g L-carnitine tartrate (3 g L-carnitine) ingested once.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of acetyl-L-carnitine as a nutritional supplement for treating cognitive decline in people with Down syndrome.
results_summary: The study provided insufficient data to draw conclusions about acetyl-L-carnitine's effectiveness, with only a narrative account available. No significant adverse events or benefits were reported.
population_specificity: Adults with Down syndrome (aged 18 and older, with one study focusing on ages 20-29).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how acetyl-L-carnitine supports mitochondrial metabolism to alleviate metabolic disturbances in astrocyte-neuronal interactions in epilepsy models.
results_summary: The study suggests acetyl-L-carnitine provides acetyl moieties for oxidation in the tricarboxylic acid cycle, potentially improving metabolic dysfunction in epilepsy. It highlights its role alongside triheptanoin in anaplerosis, refilling the tricarboxylic acid cycle.
population_specificity: Rodent models of temporal lobe epilepsy (pilocarpine-status epilepticus and pentylenetetrazole kindling models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of L-carnitine on plasma Lp(a) concentrations through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials (RCTs).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a significant reduction in Lp(a) levels with oral L-carnitine supplementation but not with intravenous administration. The effect was independent of dosage and duration of therapy, suggesting oral L-carnitine may be an effective alternative for reducing Lp(a).
population_specificity: Not specified (meta-analysis of available RCTs).
effective_dosage: Not specified (meta-regression showed no dose-dependent effect).
study_duration: Not specified (meta-regression showed no duration-dependent effect).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the pharmacokinetic bioequivalence between a new generic formulation and a branded formulation of ALC hydrochloride 590 mg in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: The study found that the test and reference formulations of ALC were bioequivalent, with similar PK profiles (Cmax and AUClast) and both were well tolerated.
population_specificity: Healthy Korean male volunteers
